subject: Re: [junit] Message texts
msgSnippet: ... Yes, but /very/ context-sensitive. I often write failure text as incredulous statements. assertNotNull( Joe has no name?! , joe.getName()); -- J. B.
messageBody:
David Plass wrote:

> So you'd write
> assertTrue("someBoolean is not true!", someBoolean);
>
> Or as another example
> assertEquals("The answer isn't the same!", expected, actual);

Yes, but /very/ context-sensitive. I often write failure text as
incredulous statements.

assertNotNull("Joe has no name?!", joe.getName());
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
